alert.note: Alert for Doddridge; Pleasants; Ritchie; Tyler; Wood (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Washington, Pleasants, central Ritchie, northwestern Doddridge, Tyler and east central Wood Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 330 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of New Martinsville to 7 miles east of St. Marys to 9 miles west of North Bend State Park. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Harrisville, St. Marys, Middlebourne, Paden City, Sistersville, Pennsboro, West Union, North Bend State Park, Matamoras, Ellenboro, Cairo, Pullman, Friendly, Fly, Alma, Maxwell, Schultz, New Matamoras, Mountain and Lima. This includes Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 18 and 51. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
